intro: Zanthoxylum azuense, commonly known as the Huayna Picchu pepper, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, red berries. The plant produces a pungent, spicy fruit that is used in traditional Andean cuisine. Its botanical features include thorny stems and aromatic, glandular leaves. Zanthoxylum azuense is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
